name: TOM YUM KUNG
description: It is central Thai food. which is popular to eat in every region in Thailand It is a food eaten with rice and It has mainly sour and spicy taste mixed with a little salty and sweet. It is divided into 2 types: Tom Yum Nam Sai and Tom Yum Nam Khon.
ingredients: Lime juice, lemongrass, coriander, shallots, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, shrimp, mushrooms, fish sauce, sugar.

name: GREEN CURRY
description: With the fresh aromatic ingredients used in South East Asian curries, I'll always be an advocate of making the curry pastes from scratch because it’s not possible to capture that flavour in jars. But it’s just not viable to do that every time I have a hankering for curry.
ingredients: Coconut milk  full fat please! Fat is where the flavour is, if you use low fat coconut milk the sauce will lack flavour. You could even use coconut cream, if you want a richer version! Chicken or vegetable broth  chicken is better (deeper flavours) but vegetable is fine if making a vegetarian version.

name: BANANA IN COCONUT MILK
description: Cavendish bananas can most certainly be used, although the Thais like to make this with the dwarf Nam Wah bananas, also called lady finger bananas because of their shape, found at some Asian stores. Apart from the smaller size, the main difference is the texture, which is less starchy than the common supermarket bananas here with a smoother and denser bite.
ingredients: coconut milk, large bananas, white sugar and salt
